result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse M Kawlewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court addresses defendant regarding a juror's concerns about personal information being given out.
Attorney Klein states that the information stays in his file and denies he gives any physical documents to anyone and did not receive juror information until 5/23/16.
Attorney Lambert has no comment.
Court will take no action at this time.

records.addlTxt:
9:31 Defendant Jesse M Kawlewski in court with attorney James Michael Klein.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court convenes without presence of jury. Attorney Lambert states parties have an agreement that defendant has 28 prior convictions. Witness Patsy Kawlewski has one prior conviction. The parties agree that if video recording is played for jury what part of it will be played.
Attorney Klein has filed a motion in limine. Video and testimony of Officer Christensen is discussed. 
Attorney Klein is objecting to jury taking notes. He asks that instruction 315 be included in preliminary instructions.
State does not object to request that jury not be allowed to take notes. He does object to instruction 315 being included in preliminary instructions.
Court grants both motions.
9:50 Jurors are brought into courtroom and are sworn. Twenty jurors are called to box.
9:56 Court reads charges and begins voir dire. 
10:03 Attorney Lambert does voir dire.
10:13 Attorney Klein does voir dire. Juror #590 is struck for cause. 
10:23 Strikes are made. Court reads preliminary jury instructions.
10:33 Twelve jurors are sworn. Remaining jurors dismissed.
10:34 Attorney Lambert gives opening statement. 
10:40 Attorney Klein gives opening statement. 
10:52 Jury in recess. Court questions defendant regarding disorderly conduct charge. 
10:53 Court in recess.
11:18 Court reconvenes with presence of jury. Douglas Christensen is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a deputy with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. Testifies as to his duties. On 12/22/15, he had contact with M.K. at the Sheriff's Department shortly after 6:00 a.m. She felt her husband had taken her cell phone and he would not give it back to her. She stated that he was at his mother's home in the City of Wisconsin Rapids. He went to that residence with Deputy Scott Goldberg and M.K. The defendant answered the door. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. He states defendant was yelling very loudly and swearing. He asked the defendant to quiet down. Defendant did not comply and he attempted to arrest defendant. He states defendant put him in a headlock and he pushed defendant backwards into the wall and he released his grip. Deputy Goldberg told defendant to stop resisting or he would be taised. When defendant was being transported to jail, defendant apologized to him. After defendant was placed in jail, he started to experience pain in his neck and shoulder. His supervisor told him to go to Emergency Room. He was diagnosed with soft tissue injury to his neck. Exhibit #1, medical report, is marked and reviewed with witness. Attorney Klein objects. Exhibit is received. He was sent home by his supervisor. He applied heat and ice and took pain medications for a couple of days. 
11:40 Attorney Klein makes statement. 
12:10 Court in recess.
1:16 Court reconvenes without presence of jury. Attorney Klein is objecting to medical records. State will amend count 1 to a charge of resisting. Defendant enters plea. Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 
1:25 Jury is brought into the courtroom and Court informs jury that case is resolved and they are dismissed.
Cover Letter & Fax Sheet from Atty. James M. Klein, dated May 24, 2016.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.
of judge. Filed by Attorney Wallace (not acted on per phone call from Attorney Wallace)

Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Bond is continued. Attorney Wallace asks for adjourned arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
